intro: Adenostylis formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan adenostylis, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Adenostylis formosana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small vertebrates.
